alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 12 at 2:41PM PST until January 14 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Southeastern Mendocino Interior zone. For the Russian River...including Hopland...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. A peak stage of about 18 feet is forecast for the Russian River at Hopland. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to late Sunday morning. Flood stage is most likely to be reached by 3 PM local time on Saturday. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 222 near Ukiah. Secondary roads in low-lying areas will be flooded in the Hopland, Ukiah, and Talmage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM PST Friday the stage was 3.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM PST.
